intro: Perityle trisecta, commonly known as the three-lobed perityle, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are divided into three distinct lobes, giving it its scientific name. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Perityle trisecta thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
